item.2: Go to Profile > Settings > Manage Account Access.
item.3: Select account and view your login name.

item.1: Use your so called Online Banking PIN, which you would use to login to your Sparkasse Online Banking in a browser.
item.2: Can’t remember at all? To set a new PIN, open your Sparkasse App, go to Profile > Settings > Authorization management > Online-Banking PIN
item.3: Note that it is not necessarily the same as the app or the TAN app password.

item.1: You received a VR-NetKey from your bank by mail, or you may have set up an alias yourself — for example, your email address or a chosen name.
item.2: Unfortunately, your VR-NetKey is not visible in your banking apps.

item.1: Use the same PIN you use to log in to your online banking in a browser.
item.2: Forgot your PIN? You can set a new PIN using your TAN app (SecureGo plus). Here is an example from Berliner Volksbank: https://www.berliner-volksbank.de/service/pin-vergessen.html
Tap on Profile in the menu at the bottom.
item.3: Your participant number is shown at the top of the screen.

name.extra: You chose your username yourself, but you don’t need it as long as you know your participant number.

item.1: Use the PIN or password you use to log in to your online banking via browser or the Commerzbank app.
item.2: Forgot your PIN or password? You can set a new PIN in the Commerzbank app under Profile > Digital Banking PIN.

item.1: Pre-filled on the login screen of your Deutsche Bank app.
item.2: On the back of your Deutsche Bank card (debit card).
item.3: In the Deutsche Bank app: tap the menu icon (three lines) in the top right > IBAN and BIC > the first three digits of your bank code (BCN).

branch.extra: You can find your three-digit branch number in one of the following places:

item.1: Pre-filled on the login screen of your Deutsche Bank app.
item.2: On the back of your Deutsche Bank card (debit card).
item.3: In the Deutsche Bank app: tap the menu icon (three lines) in the top right > IBAN and BIC > Account (without the last two digits).

accNumber.extra: You can find your 7-digit account number in one of the following places:

item.1: We hope you can find your personal phone number without our help.
Your PIN is a four-digit number that you also use to log in to your C24 app.
item.2: Forgot your PIN? You can change it in the C24 app by going to: Profile (icon in the top left) > Sicherheit & Datenschutz (Security & Privacy) > PIN ändern (Change PIN).

item.1: Your User ID is the same one you use to log in to your online banking.
item.2: If you’ve forgotten your User ID, you can retrieve it here: https://www.targobank.de/de/user/administration/UA_ForPassPriCusCurAcc.aspx
item.3: If you only have a credit card with TARGOBANK, use this link instead: https://www.targobank.de/de/user/administration/UA_ForPassPriCusCreCar.aspx

item.1: Use the same password you use to log in to your online banking in a browser.
item.3: Forgot your password? You can set a new one here: https://www.targobank.de/de/user/administration/UA_ForPassPriCusCurAcc.aspx
item.4: If you only have a TARGOBANK credit card, use this link instead: https://www.targobank.de/de/user/administration/UA_ForPassPriCusCreCar.aspx

item.1: You can have your login name sent to you by email here: https://banking.dkb.de/forgot-username
item.2: If you didn’t choose your login name yourself, it’s usually made up of the last 10 digits of your IBAN (=account number) followed by a suffix (typically _p or _c). For example: 1234567890_p.
item.3: You can find your IBAN on the back of your debit card.

item.1: Use your online banking password. This is the same password you use to log in to your online banking account via a browser or the DKB app.
item.2: Forgot your PIN? You can set a new password in the DKB app by going to: Profile > App Settings > Change Password.
